answers.answer: You don't have to have everything on the symptom list to have it. I only had 3 signs of it and I had it. I had high bp, high protein and swelling(which can be normal for any pregnancy) I did not even know I had the swelling until the Dr said I did. So even if you don't have the high bp right now but have other things on the list then you will prob still be induced. I had my daughter at 38 weeks cause of it and my SO was born at 30 weeks cause his mom had it when she was pregnant with him.
And it does not just go away, the only way to get rid of preeclampsia is to have the baby.

If they told you you have preeclampsia then you have it, its mostly just the high levels of protein in your urine. They will watch your blood pressure and you need to be careful, and your blood pressure is unpredictable, I had great blood pressure my whole pregnancy and at 35 weeks my blood pressure went from 118/64 to 180/110 in about 7 hours and they gave me an emergency c section 14 hours later.

I have Pre Eclampsia and the only symptoms i have are high BP and protein in urine. I don't have swelling and my blood work is fine. There are many things they keep track of with it. My BP today was 133/99.

question: I'm 36 weeks with preeclampisa and my blood pressure been normal . does that mean its gone or I still have it ? and I'm supposed to be induce this Wednesday but with normal blood pressure I doubt that's gonna happen .
title: preeclampisa ; please help .
